DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study test relative effectiveness Hispanic-specific eHealth intervention , `` e-Health Familias Unidas , '' prevent reduce drug use , sexual risk behavior , STIs among Hispanic youth primary care . Families recruit four pediatric primary care setting . Pediatric staff research team member , include nurse assistant mental health professional , implement eHealth Familias Unidas .
DOC.brief_title: eHealth Evidence-based Intervention ( EBI ) Latino Youth Primary Care
DOC.detailed_description: To test effectiveness eHealth Familias Unidas Primary Care prevent drug use , unprotected sexual behavior , STIs universal sample Hispanic youth , randomize trial design use two level intervention ( eHealth Familias Unidas Primary Care Treatment Usual ) subject factor five repeat measure assessment baseline , 6 , 12 , 24 , 36 month post baseline within subject factor . Participants recruit four primary care clinic : two locate within University Miami Health System , Jackson Memorial Medical Center ( South Florida 's county health hospital ) , general community clinic Miami ( affiliate either University Miami Health System Jackson Memorial Medical Center ) . The first site academic pediatric clinic within University Miami 's Health District . This practice serve mostly insured individual . The second pediatric site University Miami mobile clinic provide medical care charge uninsured youth . The third pediatric clinic public health clinic locate within Jackson Memorial Hospital , South Florida 's public health hospital . This clinic serve mostly underinsured uninsured youth . The fourth site private pediatric care clinic . In total , pediatric clinic jointly serve 3,400 Hispanic age 12 -16 per year . A total 456 Hispanic adolescent ( 12 16 year old ) primary caregiver ( expect age range 35-55 ) recruit . All adolescent participant Hispanic ancestry , male female represent . Women likely over-represented among primary caregiver . AIM 1 : Evaluate effectiveness eHealth Familias Unidas deliver primary care set ( refer hereafter eHealth Familias Unidas Primary Care ) preventing/reducing drug use , unprotected sexual behavior , sexually transmit infection ( STIs ; specifically gonorrhea chlamydia ) . H1a : eHealth Familias Unidas Primary Care effective , relative Treatment Usual , reduce frequency ( past 90-day ) drug use Hispanic adolescent time H1b : eHealth Familias Unidas Primary Care effective , relative Treatment Usual , reduce frequency ( past 90-day ) unprotected sex Hispanic adolescent time H1c : eHealth Familias Unidas Primary Care effective , relative Treatment Usual , reduce STI incidence ( specifically , incidence gonorrhea chlamydia ) . AIM 2 : Determine whether intervention effect mediate : 1 ) family function drug use unprotected sexual behavior 2 ) family function unprotected sexual behavior STI incidence . H2a : Intervention effect frequency drug use partially mediate improvement family function time H2b : Intervention effect unprotected sex partially mediate improvement family function time H2c : Intervention effect STI incidence partially mediate improvement family function decrease unprotected sexual behavior time . AIM 3 : Estimate cost effectiveness eHealth Familias Unidas Primary Care three year follow . H3 : eHealth Familias Unidas Primary Care cost effective Treatment Usual reduce drug use , unprotected sexual behavior , STI incidence . As exploratory aim , investigator collect data clinic level leadership climate primary care clinic physician staff attitude towards eHealth Familias Unidas Primary Care facilitator . Specifically , investigator explore whether clinic level leadership climate predict staff attitude towards eHealth Familias Unidas Primary Care predict change propose outcome .
